channel.title: Comments on: Vint Cerf, Chief Internet Evangelist at Google

item.title: By: joseph
item.dc:creator: joseph
item.description: No, that was a different person: <a href="http://arstechnica.com/journals/microsoft.ars/2005/9/3/1106" rel="nofollow">Ballmer tosses chairs over Google</a>, Kai-Fu Lee.
item.content:encoded: No, that was a different person: Ballmer tosses chairs over Google, Kai-Fu Lee.

item.title: By: Jim Bonfield
item.dc:creator: Jim Bonfield
item.description: Is this the guy who caused balmer to throw a chair across the room? Was he a Microsnot guy?
item.content:encoded: Is this the guy who caused balmer to throw a chair across the room? Was he a Microsnot guy?

item.title: By: Somewhat Frank
item.dc:creator: Somewhat Frank
item.description:
<strong>Google Adds An Internet Ringer In Vint Cerf</strong>
Google has announced that they have hired one of the founding fathers of the Internet, Vinton Vint Cerf to start on October 3, 2005. Vint co-designed the TCP/IP protocols that were used to develop the Internet's underlying architecture and his
item.content:encoded:
Google Adds An Internet Ringer In Vint Cerf

Google has announced that they have hired one of the founding fathers of the Internet, Vinton Vint Cerf to start on October 3, 2005. Vint co-designed the TCP/IP protocols that were used to develop the Internet’s underlying architecture and his
